FuncDef:
The l2tp session-speed auto-adjustment command enables automatic adjustment of the rate at which L2TP sessions are set up.
The undo l2tp session-speed auto-adjustment command disables automatic adjustment of the rate at which L2TP sessions are set up.
By default, the automatic adjustment function is enabled.
ExtraInfo: If the send window size of the LAC-side L2TP tunnel is small, run the l2tp session-speed auto-adjustment command to enable automatic adjustment of the rate at which L2TP sessions are set up. This allows the system to automatically adjust the rate for sending ICRQ packets based on the send window size. This function is enabled by default.
